info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 8 at 10:54AM EDT until June 13 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Hazleton and Petersburg.
Wabash River at Montezuma.
.2 To 4 inches of rainfall across portions of the basin over the last several days has led to slow increases in river levels along the main stem rivers. Localized 1 to 2 inches last night has further increased river levels with portions of the lower White and Wabash now in minor flooding. Minor flooding is expected to continue through at least Tuesday morning.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...From Monday evening to Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Flooding affects low agricultural lands, low oil fields and closes Bottoms Rd...Brothers Rd and East Governors Road in Knox County. In agricultural season...farmers are concerned at this stage.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EDT Sunday /9:30 AM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to 17.1 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 200 AM EDT /100 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY EVENING TO FRIDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
